intro: Cicendia candollei, commonly known as the white false nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and streambanks. Cicendia candollei is often found growing in association with other herbaceous plants in its native habitat.
